document.masterDocTitle: New species of Nereis (Annelida, Polychaeta, Nereididae) from Taiwanese waters

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Nereis (Annelida, Polychaeta, Nereididae) from Taiwanese waters

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Nereis
species reported from East Asia (Adopted partially from Imajima 1972 &
Wu et al. 1981
)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Tentacular cirri distally articulated..........................................................
N . articulata
n. sp.
2. Area III with 20+ paragnaths and Area V with at least 1 paragnath.............................................. 3
- Area III without 20+ paragnaths and Area V with or without paragnaths......................................... 5
3. Area V with 1–3 paragnaths, blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with teeth................................. 4

- Area V with 2–18 paragnaths (depended on body size), blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with serrations.....................................................................................
N . neoneanthes Hartman, 1948

4. Blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers sickle-shaped, base with 2 small teeth on cutting edge.......................................................................................
N . guangdongensis Wu, Sun & Yang, 1981

- Blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers rod-like with more than 10 teeth on cutting edge........
N . nuwalianensis
n. sp.
6. Area I with paragnaths, Area II with at least 10 paragnaths.................................................... 7

- Area I without paragnaths, Area II with 0–2 paragnaths...........................
N . longior Khlebovich & Wu, 1962

7. Dorsal cirri longer than dorsal ligules, longest tentacular cirri reaching chaetiger 8...........
N . surugaense Imajima, 1972

- Dorsal cirri shorter than dorsal ligules, longest tentacular cirri reaching chaetiger 10–12.............................................................................
N . surugaense nanhaiensis Shen & Sun in Sun, Wu & Shen, 1978
8. Areas VII & VIII with 1 or 2 transverse rows of paragnaths................................................... 9
- Areas VII & VIII with 3 or more rows or a transverse band of paragnaths....................................... 22

10. Blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers fusiform with smooth surface..............
N . sinensis Wu, Sun & Yang, 1981
- Blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers not fusiform without smooth surface.................................. 11

11. Blade of notopodial falcigers distally bifid.................................................
N . taiwanensis
n. sp.

- Blade of notopodial falcigers sickle-shaped with serrations....................
N . huanghaiensis Wu, Sun & Yang, 1981

- Blade of notopodial falcigers with teeth...........................................
N . denhamensis Augener, 1913

- Area III with less than 20 paragnaths..............................................
N. heteromorpha Horst, 1924

15. Area VI with 7 teeth, notopodial dorsal ligules of posterior chaetiger enlarged...................
N . nichollsi Kott, 1951

- Area VI with 10 teeth, notopodial dorsal ligules of posterior chaetiger not enlarged...............
N . shitipingensis
n. sp.

- Area VI with mostly 10 or more paragnaths................................................
N . taitungensis
n. sp.

18. Areas VII & VIII with more than 40 paragnaths.........................................
N . jacksoni Kinberg, 1866

- Areas VII & VIII with 10–14 paragnaths......................
N . zhongshaensis Shen & Sun in Sun, Wu & Shen, 1978
19. Blade of notopodial falcigers with smooth surface.......................................................... 20

- Areas I & II without paragnaths...................................
N . dayana Shen & Sun in Sun, Wu & Shen, 1978

21. Blade of notopodial falciger distally bifid..............................................
N . falcaria ( Willey, 1905 )

- Blade of notopodial falciger distally not bifid..........................
N . falcaria multignatha Wu, Sun & Yang, 1981
22. Areas VII & VIII without an isolate row of paragnaths...................................................... 23
23. Areas VII & VIII with 3–4 rows of large paragnaths................................................... N . sp. A
- Areas VII & VIII with 5–6 rows of small paragnaths................................................... N . sp. B
24. Areas VII & VIII with 1 row of large teeth anteriorly and 2 or more rows of small teeth posteriorly................... 25

- Areas VII & VIII with 1 row of large teeth anteriorly and several rows of large teeth interspaced with small teeth posteriorly .................................................................................................. 35

26. Both Areas II & IV with 50 or more paragnaths............................................
N . izukai Okuda, 1939

- Both Areas II & IV with less than 40 paragnaths.........................................
N . abyssa Imajima, 2009
27. Areas VII & VIII with 1 row of large teeth and 2-3 rows of small teeth......................................... 28
- Areas VII & VIII with 1 row of large teeth and 4 or more rows of small teeth.................................... 31

28. Notopodial dorsal ligules rounded on anterior chaetigers.................................
N . pelagica Linnaeus, 1758
- Notopodial dorsal ligule not rounded on anterior chaetigers.................................................. 29

29. Notopodial dorsal ligules with rectangular elongation on posterior chaetigers, blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with serrations........................................................................
N . vexillosa Grube, 1851

- Notopodial dorsal ligules without rectangular elongation on posterior chaetigers, blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with 2–3 teeth...................................................................................... 30

30. Surface of dorsum on anterior chaetigers with narrow horizontal stripes.....................
N . zonata Malmgren, 1867

- Surface of dorsum on anterior chaetigers without narrow horizontal stripes.....................
N . persica Fauvel, 1911
31. Notopodial dorsal ligules rounded on anterior chaetigers..................................................... 32
- Notopodial dorsal ligules not rounded on anterior chaetigers.................................................. 34

32. Dorsal cirri 2.0–2.3 times as long as dorsal ligules.........................................
N . longdongensis
n. sp.

33. Area V with no paragnaths............................................
N . multignatha Imajima & Hartman, 1964

- Area V with 3–7 paragnaths......................................
N. multignatha paraneanthes Khlebovich, 1996

34. Notopodial dorsal ligules triangular, blunt-tipped, on anterior chaetigers, blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with serration or smooth..........................................................................
N . paporae
n. sp.

- Notopodial dorsal ligules narrow triangular to digitiform on anterior chaetigers, blade of notopodial homogomph falcigers with 2–3 teeth............................................................................
N . wuchiensis
n. sp.

35. Notopodial dorsal ligules with rectangular elongation on posterior chaetigers............
N . heterocirrata Treadwell, 1931

- Notopodial dorsal ligules with base enlarged to leaf-like form on posterior chaetigers...........
N . grubei (Kinberg, 1866)
